items.title: Microsoft partners UAE big data firm for AI startup accelerator
items.summary:
- Presight, a UAE-based big data analytics firm, signed an MoU with Microsoft for an AI startup accelerator.
- The initiative aims to support AI startups with access to technology, mentorship, and venture funding.
- Microsoft will provide resources through its Founders Hub, including cloud services and technical guidance.
- Startups will receive mentorship and market strategy insights from Microsoft's network.
- Applications for the Presight AI-Startup Accelerator close on April 10, 2025.

items.title: Chinese chip equipment firm unveils 30 locally made chip tools
items.summary:
- SiCarrier introduced 30 new chip tools at Semicon China 2025, focusing on domestic control for semiconductor self-sufficiency.
- The company will mass-produce tools for diffusion, etching, and thin film applications, emphasizing alternative materials and 3D architecture.
- SiCarrier's tools incorporate fully localized core components, indicating progress in an industry historically reliant on foreign technology.

items.title: Abu Dhabi’s ADQ acquires 63% stake in Dubai courier firm Aramex
items.summary:
- Abu Dhabi sovereign investor ADQ acquires a 63.26% stake in Aramex through Q Logistics Holding.
- Q Logistics secured 40.57% of Aramex shares, adding to ADQ’s existing 22.69% stake, surpassing UAE M&A requirements.
- The offer was priced at 3 dirham (US$0.82) per share, valuing Aramex at 4.39 billion dirham (US$1.2 billion).
- Aramex shares rose 1.81% post-announcement.
- ADQ’s acquisition aims to strengthen its transport and logistics portfolio, which includes companies like Abu Dhabi Ports Company and Etihad Airways.

items.title: Tencent, Alibaba introduce AI tools for farming in rural China
items.summary:
- Rural communities in China are adopting AI for farming, pest control, and ecommerce due to increased internet access and mobile phone usage.
- Tencent and Alibaba are at the forefront of this transition, offering tools like Tencent’s chatbot Yuanbao and Alibaba’s Tongyi for various agricultural needs.
- A village chief in Jiaohe, Jilin, implemented AI tools for farming advice, livestock management, and online promotions in collaboration with Tencent.
- Tencent's "AI Goes Rural" program aims to make AI solutions more relevant for rural areas, working alongside local officials.
- Alibaba's partnership with the Zhejiang provincial government focuses on integrating AI to tackle rural challenges.

items.title: Samsung Bespoke AI fridge locates phones, adjusts to weather
items.summary:
- Samsung has introduced the Bespoke AI fridge that can locate lost phones.
- The fridge adjusts its internal temperature based on real-time weather conditions.
- This innovation showcases the growing integration of smart technology in household appliances.

items.title: Temasek considers selling testing firm Element Materials
items.summary:
- Temasek Holdings is considering selling Element Materials Technology, a UK-based testing company.
- The company was acquired in 2022 for over US$7 billion, including debt.
- Temasek is working with advisers to gauge interest from potential buyers, including strategic firms.
- Element expanded by purchasing National Technical Systems, a US-based testing firm, in September 2022.
- Temasek declined to comment on the potential sale, and Element has not responded to inquiries.

items.title: How startups can make chatbots more than a digital dead end
items.summary:
- Businesses are investing billions in AI chatbots, with banks projected to spend US$18.4 billion by 2028.
- AI chatbots struggle with context, nuance, and complex queries, excelling only in structured interactions.
- A Gartner survey revealed only 14% of customer issues are resolved through self-service, indicating many AI solutions fall short.
- Overall effectiveness of chatbots scored 60%, with a resolution rate of 67%, allowing room for improvement, particularly in telecommunications.

items.title: Perplexity AI tackles user concerns as CEO assures stability plans
items.author: Aravind Srinivas
items.summary:
- Aravind Srinivas, CEO of Perplexity AI, addresses user concerns about product updates and performance issues in a Reddit post.
- Discussed the introduction of "Auto" mode to simplify user experience by auto-selecting the best AI model.
- Acknowledged user reports of inconsistencies, clarified that specific models are task-oriented, and announced plans to merge Pro and Reasoning modes.
- Highlighted infrastructure challenges causing user interface bugs and reliability issues; prioritizing infrastructure improvements.
- Transitioning from Python to GoLang and developing a more powerful deep research agent.
- Affirmed financial stability, increasing revenue, and no IPO plans before 2028.

items.title: Rebooted Taobao looks beyond China
items.author: Melissa Goh
items.summary:
- Taobao is launching an English app in nearly a dozen Asian markets to enhance the shopping experience for non-Chinese customers.
- The platform's initiatives aim to address previous pain points, such as language barriers and delivery challenges.
- Taobao faces competition from established regional players like Shopee, known for better returns and after-sales support.

items.title: 20 largest exits in Singapore
Student loan startup founder guilty of fraud in JPMorgan deal
items.summary:
- Charlie Javice, founder of Frank, found guilty of fraud on Mar. 28.
- Defrauded JPMorgan Chase during a US$175 million acquisition in 2021.
- Jury concluded she fabricated customer data, falsely claiming 4 million users instead of the 300,000 legitimate ones.
- Marketing emails revealed a 70% bounce rate, indicating fraud.
- Hired a math professor to create fake customer information.
- Facing a possible decades-long prison sentence; sentencing scheduled for August 2025.
- Founded Frank in 2017 to simplify financial aid applications; featured in Forbes’ 30 Under 30 list in 2019.

items.title: Amazon restructures leadership following streaming struggles
items.summary:
- Amazon confirmed the departure of Jennifer Salke as head of Amazon MGM Studios as part of a leadership streamlining effort.
- Film and TV studio heads will now report directly to Mike Hopkins, head of Amazon MGM Studios and Prime Video.
- Salke oversaw major projects like Reacher, Jack Ryan, The Boys, and Fallout since joining in 2018.
- Major investments, including The Rings of Power and Citadel, faced criticism for high costs and mixed reception.
- The Rings of Power cost over US$1 billion but did not achieve widespread global success.
- Amazon has encountered creative control issues with the James Bond franchise since acquiring MGM in 2022.
- Post-departure, Salke intends to establish her own film and TV production company with a first-look deal at Amazon.

items.title: OpenAI must go for-profit by 2025 to secure $40b
items.summary:
- OpenAI must become a for-profit entity by the end of 2025 to secure $40 billion in funding led by SoftBank.
- If the transition is not completed within the year, the funding may drop to $20 billion.
- This requirement is part of a two-year timeline set after OpenAI's last financing round.
- The company claims this shift is essential for funding advancements in its AI models.
- OpenAI has not provided any comments regarding this transition.

items.title: Rebel Foods eyes IPO in 2026
items.author: Ankush Grover
items.summary:
- Rebel Foods is considering a public listing in 2026 amid expansion efforts.
- The company operates 350 kitchens in 70 cities in India and has 27 international locations.
- Reports a 42% reduction in net loss to 378.2 crore rupee and 19% revenue growth to 1,420.2 crore rupee in FY24.
- Launch of QuickiES, a 15-minute food delivery service to compete with Zomato and Swiggy.
- Utilizes technology for food quality monitoring and employs over 8,000 staff with a focus on training.

items.title: Blackstone reportedly eyes TikTok US minority stake
items.summary:
- Blackstone is considering a minority investment in TikTok’s US operations.
- Discussions involve joining ByteDance’s non-Chinese shareholders like Susquehanna International Group and General Atlantic.
- The proposal aims to restructure TikTok’s US business and reduce Chinese ownership to below 20% for compliance with US regulations.

items.title: Indian Cocktail Brand O’Be Shuts Down After Struggle to Find Buyer
items.author: Nitesh Prakash
items.summary:
- O’Be Cocktails has ceased operations after failing to find a buyer for over a year.
- Founded in 2019, the brand specialized in ready-to-drink cocktails and operated in nine states, including Bengaluru and Goa.
- Investors included Ola co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal and Tracxn founder Abhishek Goyal.
- In 2023, O’Be Cocktails raised an undisclosed pre-series A round led by Inflection Point Ventures.
- Challenges in the Indian alcoholic beverage market were cited, including commoditization and price sensitivity affecting sustainability.

items.title: SpaceX allowed Chinese investments via offshore hubs
items.summary:
- SpaceX permits Chinese investors to buy stakes through offshore hubs like the Cayman Islands.
- Investments must be funneled through such entities to bypass direct investment restrictions.
- Iqbaljit Kahlon testified about raising funds from Chinese investors and channeling them to acquire SpaceX shares.
- A 2021 deal for a Chinese firm to buy $50 million in shares was canceled due to national security concerns after media scrutiny.
- SpaceX has no formal policy on foreign ownership but aims to avoid investors from adversarial nations.
- Experts raise alarms about using offshore entities potentially hiding foreign influence in sensitive technology areas.

items.title: Intel announces board retirements before shareholder meeting
items.author: Omar Ishrak, Tsu-Jae King Liu, Risa Lavizzo-Mourey
items.summary:
- Intel Corp. will see board members Omar Ishrak, Tsu-Jae King Liu, and Risa Lavizzo-Mourey retire.  
- They will not seek reelection at the annual shareholder meeting scheduled for May 6, reducing the board to 11 members.  
- This follows the addition of independent directors Eric Meurice and Steve Sanghi last year.  
- Chairman Frank Yeary emphasized the aim for a board with the right mix of skills and expertise.  
- The changes coincide with Lip-Bu Tan's appointment as CEO, following Pat Gelsinger's departure amid concerns over Intel’s recovery pace.  
- Details were provided in Intel’s annual proxy statement.

items.title: China’s hooked on microdramas. Will Southeast Asia tune in?
items.summary:
- Chinese microdramas are gaining popularity and may expand to Southeast Asia.
- These short dramas often feature episodes lasting around 15 minutes.
- Local adaptations of Chinese microdramas could attract viewers in Southeast Asian countries.

items.title: Who’s investing in India’s education startups?
Indian produce delivery startup Pluckk bags $10m series A
items.author: Prateek Gupta
items.summary:
- Pluckk, a Mumbai-based fruit and vegetable delivery startup, raised INR 85 crore (US$10 million) in series A funding from Euro Gulf Investment.
- Regulatory filings show the board approved issuing 3,023 compulsorily convertible preference shares (CCPS) at a face value of 10 rupee (US$0.12), with a premium of 2.81 lakh rupee (US$3,278) each on Mar. 11.
- The funds will be used for growth initiatives and to repay inter-corporate deposits (ICDs).
- Founded in 2021, Pluckk offers over 400 products and operates in Mumbai, Delhi, and Bengaluru, also selling via platforms like Amazon, Swiggy, and Zepto.
- In 2023, it received undisclosed funding from Bollywood actor Kareena Kapoor Khan and in September 2024, it acquired D2C nutrition brand Upnourish for US$1.4 million.

items.title: Xpeng invests $413m in flying cars, plans factory by 2026
items.summary:
- Xpeng is investing 3 billion yuan (US$413 million) in its eVTOL aircraft business.
- A factory in China is planned to start operations in 2026, with a production capacity of 10,000 aircraft annually.
- Xpeng's CEO, He Xiaopeng, stated the global flying car market could reach US$2 trillion in the next 20 years.
- Currently, low-altitude aircraft account for 3% to 5% of automotive sales volume but 20% of sales revenue.
- The investment is part of Chinese companies exploring new transportation opportunities in the competitive EV market.

items.title: These are Asia’s most active investors in AI
items.summary:
- The article highlights the most active investors in Asia's AI sector over the past 12 months.
- Investors are ranked by the number of deals made, favoring early-stage investors.
- Only firms that have invested in at least three AI startups in Asia during this timeframe are featured.
- The list is updated daily, although the publication date may not reflect the latest changes.
- Readers are encouraged to report any inaccuracies to the provided email.

items.title: Pop Mart hit $1.8b revenue in 2024, up 106.9% from 2023
SpaceX offers Starlink kits for quake relief in Myanmar, Thailand
items.summary:
- SpaceX announced it will provide Starlink kits for communication assistance after an earthquake in Myanmar and Thailand.
- The provision of kits is contingent upon receiving necessary governmental approvals.
- The impact of the earthquake is currently being assessed as relief efforts are ongoing.

items.title: Down but not out
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's startup funding has decreased for the third consecutive year in 2024.
- The highest funding deals this week did not include startups from Southeast Asia.
- Notable recent events include the eFishery scandal and ongoing political uncertainty affecting the region's tech landscape.
- Apna Mart in India raised $25 million, while others like Brevel and Nayla Finance also secured funding.
- Duab.ai and Shipway were acquired for undisclosed sums.

items.title: SoftBank reportedly plans $1t AI parks in the US
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp. is considering investing over US$1 trillion in AI industrial parks across the US.
- Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son is expected to outline his vision during a visit to the US, focusing on using AI-equipped robots to address labor shortages.
- In January, SoftBank announced a US$100 billion partnership with OpenAI and Oracle to develop AI infrastructure, aiming to increase funding to US$500 billion for data centers and campuses.
- Abu Dhabi’s state investor MGX will support the initiative, with the first computing system planned for construction in Texas.
- SoftBank has not confirmed the US$1 trillion figure or provided details on the timeline or scope of the proposed parks.

items.title: India court rules Google’s billing policy anti-competitive
Charting Asia’s M&As: When do startups usually make an exit?
Huawei execs accused of approving bribes to EU lawmakers
items.summary:
- Belgian authorities accused Huawei executives of approving alleged bribes to EU lawmakers in 2021.
- A Huawei lobbyist reportedly offered €15,000 to a Member of the European Parliament and €1,500 to co-signers promoting Huawei's interests.
- Four individuals arrested for corruption; a fifth was released on bail facing money laundering charges.
- The case has heightened scrutiny of EU corruption after the Qatargate scandal.
- MEP Fulvio Martusciello is accused of accepting €15,000, which he denies; his assistant is under house arrest.
- Huawei claims a zero-tolerance policy for corruption and is cooperating with authorities.
- The European Commission and Parliament have not issued comments regarding the allegations.
- Concerns about Huawei's connections with the EU continue, with some member states limiting its equipment in critical infrastructure.

items.title: Swiggy, Zomato may pay 2% for gig workers’ earnings for pension
US SEC drops investigation into Crypto.com without charges
items.summary:
- The US SEC has completed its investigation into Crypto.com without enforcement actions as of March 27.
- The probe began after a Wells notice was issued to Crypto.com in October, indicating potential charges.
- Crypto.com previously sued the SEC for overreach but withdrew the lawsuit in December.
- The SEC has not commented publicly on its decision on the investigation.
- This case follows other dropped investigations into crypto firms like Kraken, Coinbase, and Ripple.
- The SEC is updating its guidance on the crypto sector and has formed a new task force under incoming Chair Paul Atkins.
- Crypto.com continues to operate without legal challenges from the SEC, serving over 140 million customers.

items.title: 50 rising greentech startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists cleantech startups in Asia that have recently closed funding rounds.
- The list is continually updated and includes companies up to series E stage.
- Each entry contains key details about the respective funding round.

items.title: Musk’s xAI buys X social media platform for $33b
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s xAI has acquired social media platform X in an all-stock transaction.
- The deal values xAI at US$80 billion and X at US$33 billion, including US$12 billion in debt.
- This acquisition follows xAI’s rapid growth since its founding two years ago.
- The companies plan to combine resources, such as data, computational power, and talent, to enhance user experiences and expand global impact.
- No additional details about operational changes or leadership structure post-acquisition have been disclosed.

items.title: BYD to invest $10b in its first Indian EV factory
items.summary:
- BYD plans to invest US$10 billion in a facility near Hyderabad, Telangana.
- The new plant will manufacture battery systems and electric vehicles, targeting an annual production capacity of 600,000 EVs by 2032.
- Includes a battery unit with a 20 GWh annual capacity, marking BYD's first factory in India.
- This investment is part of India's growing attraction for global EV manufacturers like Tesla.
- India recorded over 1.9 million EV registrations in 2024, supported by policy changes such as reduced import duties.

items.title: EU tariffs cut Chinese EV market share to 6.9% in Europe
items.summary:
- Chinese automakers' share of the European EV market dropped to 6.9% in February 2025, the lowest since February 2023.
- This decline is attributed to EU tariffs on Chinese-made EVs, impacting their market expansion.
- Overall European EV sales grew by 26%, with established brands like Volkswagen benefiting significantly.
- BYD saw its registrations almost double to 4,436 units, while MG faced a sharp decline due to tariffs up to 45.3%.
- Xpeng and Leapmotor reported growth; Xpeng's registrations surged 259% year-on-year.
- Total Chinese EV registrations decreased by 3.2% to 9,837 units amid stringent tariffs.

items.title: Starlink may face premium pricing in India
items.summary:
- Starlink may implement premium pricing in India due to limited capacity, per a Jefferies report.
- Current infrastructure supports 180,000 users at 100 Mbps; expected to grow to 5.7 million by 2030.
- Projected pricing could be 2-3 times higher than traditional providers, similar to pricing in the US, Kenya, and Nigeria.
- Starlink is facing capacity constraints and awaiting key approvals like the GMPCS license.
- Telecom Regulatory Authority of India is considering a shorter spectrum allocation of five years.
- Partnerships with Jio and Airtel may assist distribution amidst limited competition from established telecom players.
- India is strategically important for Starlink, especially following exclusion from China and Russia, but its impact on major telecom operators is likely minimal.

items.title: US, China compete for leadership in humanoid robotics
items.summary:
- The US and China are engaged in a competitive race to develop humanoid robotics, focusing on innovative technologies.
- Key players from both countries are investing heavily in research and development to advance their capabilities.
- The outcomes of this rivalry could significantly influence global technology leadership and economic power dynamics.

items.title: Who’s investing in India’s health startups?
Chinese top chipmakers struggle with rising competition
items.summary:
- Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) reported a 27% increase in revenue for 2024 to US$8 billion.
- Net profit for SMIC fell 45.4% year-on-year to US$493 million due to challenges in the legacy chip market and US export restrictions.
- Hua Hong Semiconductor's revenue decreased by 12.3% to US$2 billion, and net profit dropped 79.2% to US$58 million, leading to a decline in its share price.
- Both companies are facing intense competition in China's semiconductor market with high-end chip production restrictions.
- In contrast, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) posted a 40% increase in net profit to US$35 billion.

items.title: The hidden alliances between Southeast Asia’s VCs, uncovered
items.summary:
- VCs in Southeast Asia often co-invest, revealing hidden alliances among firms.
- Some firms invest together consistently, indicating deeper relationships, while others avoid collaboration.
- A visual representation shows relationships among VCs based on deal data from the past two years.
- This information may assist startup founders in understanding fundraising dynamics.
- A table lists the top 20 VCs by the number of co-investors and collaborations.

items.title: AI agriculture firm Cropin partners with Walmart
items.summary:
- Cropin collaborates with Walmart to enhance agricultural technology.
- The partnership aims to leverage AI for better crop management and yield.
- Focus on improving supply chain efficiency and farmer connectivity.

items.title: AWS denies reports of 10% staff cuts in China
items.summary:
- Amazon Web Services (AWS) denies claims of layoffs of approximately 10% in Greater China operations.
- AWS describes local media reports as "seriously inaccurate" and emphasizes commitment to hiring.
- Reports suggested non-renewal of contracts unless employees achieved top performance ratings, along with a hiring freeze in non-sales roles.
- AWS has not clarified details on performance evaluations or contract processes in China.

items.title: What the IDX plunge means for tech
items.summary:
- The Indonesia Stock Exchange’s composite index dropped by 6% on March 18, leading to a temporary trading halt.
- The rupiah fell to its lowest value since the 1998 Asian Financial Crisis, signaling potential economic instability.
- Experts are divided on the long-term impact on Indonesian tech startups, with some viewing challenges as short-term corrections and others noting deeper effects.
- IDX-listed tech firms like GoTo and Bukalapak remain stable despite broader market concerns, but investor confidence is wavering.
- The weakening rupiah could affect venture capital valuations and returns but may offer investors better opportunities.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Southeast Asia’s startups
items.summary:
- The article lists the most active investors in Southeast Asia's startups over the past 12 months.
- It highlights firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region during this time.
- The list is based on the number of deals done by each firm and is a work in progress for accuracy improvements.

items.title: Huawei rebounds, hits $118b revenue with global expansion
items.summary:
- Huawei reports expected revenues of 860 billion yuan (US$118 billion) for 2024, approaching 2020 levels.
- The company has diversified its operations into smart-driving technology, 5G infrastructure, and energy storage to mitigate US sanctions.
- Partnerships with state-owned automakers have resulted in tripled sales for Aito-branded EVs in the past year.
- Projected smartphone shipments for 2024 are over 45 million units, reflecting a 25% increase year-on-year despite challenges in chip production.
- Huawei continues to expand its global presence despite difficulties in Western markets.

items.title: S Korea keeps DeepSeek ban over data concerns
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- South Korea has not set a timeline for resuming the DeepSeek AI app from China due to data management concerns.
- The app's suspension began on Feb. 15, 2025, initiated by the Personal Information Protection Commission (PIPC).
- Violations of personal information protection laws led to the suspension, which will continue until compliance is achieved.
- DeepSeek aims to comply with South Korea's Personal Information Protection Act, acknowledging previous shortcomings.

items.title: TSMC-linked Gallant Micro reports record $30m AI chip orders
items.summary:
- Gallant Micro reported record orders of NT$1 billion (US$30.21 million) for 2025.
- Orders are driven by strong demand for advanced chip packaging technology, notably CoWoS technology for AI chips.
- Order visibility extends through the first quarter of 2026, with optimism for continued growth due to the AI boom.
- The company plans to establish a US office and production line, with the first line expected in two years.

items.title: Indian fintech startup axiTrust nets $2.6m seed funding
items.author: Aditya Tulsian, Mukund Daga, Rajeev Chari
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based fintech startup axiTrust Surety raised ₹22 crore (US$2.57 million) in seed funding led by General Catalyst.
- Other participants in the round included Veltis Capital, Good Capital, and AngelList.
- axiTrust, founded in 2024, offers micro surety bonds for MSMEs as a collateral-free alternative to traditional bank guarantees.
- The company plans to integrate its platform with MSME systems for enhanced insights and automation.
- The startup, currently an eight-member team, aims to use the funds for hiring, app development, and marketing.
- General Catalyst has a history of backing successful fintech companies like CRED and Uni Cards.

items.title: Asia layoff tracker: EV players Scorpio Electric, Zypp slash jobs
items.summary:
• Tech in Asia updates layoff tracker regularly, focusing on job cuts in the tech industry.
• Economic uncertainty and bleak fundraising outlook continue to lead to layoffs across Asia.
• Companies like Oddle, Zypp Electric, and Scorpio Electric have made recent staffing cuts due to these pressures.
• Zypp Electric aims for an IPO by late 2026, while Scorpio Electric plans to deliver its first e-bike amid layoffs.
• Total funding in Southeast Asia, India, and China fell significantly in 2024, influencing job cuts.
